results.firPara: Steve Peters, the psychiatrist tasked with helping Englands footballers prepare for major tournaments, is unlikely to be kept on as part of the new management regime despite plans at the Football Association to expand that side of the operation.
results.secPara: Peters, recruited before the 2014 World Cup with Steven Gerrard among those endorsing his work to Roy Hodgson, is a popular figure with several England players and well respected within his industry because of his work at Liverpool as well as with Sir Chris Hoy, Ronnie OSullivan and members of Team GB at the London Olympics.
results.webTitle: Steve Peters likely to leave England role following Roy Hodgson’s departure

results.firPara: The Jekyll and Hyde nature of Marc Wilmots Belgium continued, despite a fast start, in a match where Romelu and Jordan Lukaku were both at fault
results.secPara: The Jekyll and Hyde nature of Marc Wilmots Belgium continued, despite a fast start, in a match where Romelu and Jordan Lukaku were both at fault
results.webTitle: Belgium’s golden generation fail to show mettle and pay for Lukakus’ mistakes

results.firPara: Thats all from me for tonight! I have to go and record an episode of our European Football Daily podcast, which should make for very pleasant listening for our Welsh listeners tomorrow. Youll be able to download it in all the usual places or listen to it on site later tonight or first thing in the morning. If youre not already a regular listener, heres last nights episode for you to try out. Thanks for your time and your emails, which have gone largely unread due to the frenetic pace of the match.
results.secPara: So thats that, then! Its worth repeating Wales are through to the semi-finals of Euro 2016 and join hands to do their sprint-and-slide of honour into one of the corners of the ground that is peopled by their fans. Belgiums players, by contrast, traipse off looking thoroughly despondent. They were a goal up against a team they almost certainly consider to be Gareth Bale And Ten Other Blokes, but somehow contrived to lose ... and lose heavily. Theyre out and Wales go into the last four, where theyll meet Cristiano Ronaldo And Ten Other Blokes.
results.webTitle: Wales v Belgium: Euro 2016 quarter-final – as it happened

results.firPara: Wales could hear the call of history. They reached the quarter-finals of the 1958 World Cup but had never been in the semi-finals of a major tournament and the challenge was to surpass those sepia-tinted images. How they answered it on a night that will surely go down as their finest on a football field.
results.secPara: It had looked grim for the opening 25 minutes when Belgium – star-studded Belgium, the team ranked No2 in the world – came at Wales from all angles. Radja Nainggolans 30-yard thunderbolt felt as though it might be the prompt for a rout.
results.webTitle: Wales in dreamland after Hal Robson-Kanu’s magic touch stuns Belgium

results.firPara: Italys manager pays glowing tribute to a side who are yet to concede a goal in the tournament and are the most complete side in the world
results.secPara: Italys manager pays glowing tribute to a side who are yet to concede a goal in the tournament and are the most complete side in the world
results.webTitle: Antonio Conte lauds Germany as Italy attempt the absolutely extraordinary

results.firPara: Crystal Palace have formalised their interest in Christian Benteke by submitting an opening bid worth £25m to Liverpool for the Belgium forward.
results.secPara: The offer was tabled on the day Palace announced the signings of Andros Townsend, for what is currently a club record £13m from Newcastle United, and the France No2 goalkeeper, Steve Mandanda, for £1.4m from Marseille on a contract through to 2019. A fee of around £12m has also been agreed with West Ham United for the former England under-21s centre-half James Tomkins.
results.webTitle: Crystal Palace submit £25m bid for Liverpool’s Christian Benteke

results.firPara: • Ibrahimovic moves to Old Trafford on a one-year contract
results.secPara: Manchester United have confirmed the signing of Zlatan Ibrahimovic on a one-year contract.
results.webTitle: Manchester United confirm signing of Zlatan Ibrahimovic

results.firPara: Watford have confirmed that their captain Troy Deeney has signed a new five-year contract.
results.secPara: The 28-year-old, who scored 13 Premier League goals last season as Watford comfortably survived in their first season after promotion, was the subject of a £25m bid from Leicester City last month.
results.webTitle: Watford captain Troy Deeney signs new five-year contract
